The '''Sea of Sighs''' is an inland sea in [[Essos]], located at the north-western end of the [[Valyria|Valyrian Peninsula]]. The city of [[Mantarys]] is located at its north-eastern end.<ref>[http://viewers-guide.hbo.com/game-of-thrones/season2/#!/locations/valyria/ HBO viewers guide, season 2 map, Valyria entry]</ref>
sections.In the books:
In the ''[[A Song of Ice and Fire]]'' novels, the Sea of Sighs is in the same location, in what is known as the Lands of the Long Summer. The 'demon road' from [[Volantis]] runs along its northern shore, but the road is considered cursed and few dare to use its perils to reach [[Slaver's Bay]] to the east, most preferring the sea route south around Valyria itself.

It is not known if the Sea of Sighs existed before the Doom of Valyria, or was created during the volcanic tumults of that event. The latter seems more likely, as the map collection ''The Lands of Ice and Fire''Â reveals that the Sea of Sighs appears to be colored blood-red, suggesting an ominous history.
